content.description: A fun jug ladder ascends the clean right side of the West face. Pull on the bullet white holds, and figure out the crux mantel move!
content.protection: A pad. It has a flat landing.
content.location: On the right side of the West face, start just to the left of where the traverse starts.

content.description: Cracked Eggs climbs a great warm-up crack on the south face. The crux is pulling on. It is a fun climb for warming up.
content.protection: A pad. It has a flat landing.
content.location: It ascends an obvious splitter crack on the boulder's south face.

content.description: This is one of my favorite traverses anywhere. It starts on the right side of the boulder (start sitting on the rock) and traverses left via slopers, crimps, and buckets on the rail. It is easy on the skin, too. I guess the hardest part is in the middle, but the last section isn't easy. Do yourself a favor and get on this one.
content.protection: Use however many pads you want. I usually just do it with 1.
content.location: This starts on the right side, traverses left on the rail, and joins up with the arete.
